tool.name: Meta-Analysis
tool.description: approach with a fixed effect model for untargeted metabolomics
tool.command:
meta_analysis.py --wide $input --design $design --uniqID $uniqID --study $study --treatment "$treatment" --contrast $contrast
##Default is set to only use Fixed-effect model, use standard mean difference for effect size, and unbiased estimation for cmMethod --model "FE" --effectSize "SMD" --cmMethod "UB" --summary $summary --report $report

param.name: input
param.label: Wide Dataset
param.help: Input your tab-separated wide format dataset. If file is not tab-separated see TIP below.

param.name: design
param.label: Design File
param.help: Input your design file (tab-separated). Note you need a 'sampleID' column. If not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Unique Feature ID
param.help: Name of the column in your wide dataset that contains unique feature identifiers.

param.name: study
param.label: Study
param.help: Name of the column in your design file that contains batch/study information.

param.name: treatment
param.label: Genotype/Strain
param.help: Name of the column in your design file that specifies which strains/genotypes are to be compared

param.name: contrast/pathway
param.label: The contrast/metabolic pathway to be used for the meta-analysis
param.help: Enter the name of the mutant(s) followed by the strain of the control. If running with several mutants to determine the effects of a knock out gene on a metabolic pathway, enter the names of each of the strains to be analyzed. Make sure these are only separated by a single comma (no spaces)

tool.help:
@TIP_AND_WARNING@
**Tool Description**
Metabolomics experiments have variations in sample acquisition, extraction, and data acquisition (Gouveia et al., 2021) with many large-scale experiments subdividing the samples into smaller batches of samples.
This meta-analysis tool calculates batch-level summary statistics generated using metafor: Meta-Analysis Package for R (REF). We note that the version wrapped here has been tested using the mean difference (MD) to estimate the effect size, unbiased estimates of the sampling variance (UB) and a fixed effects (FE) model.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input**
- Two input datasets are required.
@WIDE@
**NOTE:** The sample IDs must match the sample IDs in the Design File (below). Extra columns will automatically be ignored.
@METADATA@
@UNIQID@
**Batch/Study** - Enter the name of the column in the design file that contains the batch information for each sample.
**Genotype**
- Enter the name of the column in the design file that contains the information to be contrasted. For example, if you want to contrast strain KJ550 and control strain PD1074 and this information is in a column called 'genotype'.
**Contrast/Pathway**
- Name of the strains that you want to compare. If doing a pathway study involving multiple strains, please separate each genotypes/strains with commas (no spaces)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output**
This tool outputs two different files: (1) a summary CSV file that contains the statistical metrics of the batch effect with the following columns: - featureID - effect - Calculated estimated batch effect - se - Standard Error - z_value - p_value - ci_low - lower confidence interval - ci_upper - upper confidence interval
(2) a report file that contains a description of how much variability and heterogeneity is has been calculated for each sample, and what the results of the fixed effects model were
